summary: Execute R-code from vim on Mac OS X
name: R.vim - Nijs
description: This script is a related to vimscript#1048. However, it only works only on Mac OS X and does not require funnel.pl (vimscript#221) or any other code. It uses AppleScript embedded in the R.vim file to send selected lines of code to an R buffer (press <F3>). It is also possible to have all code in a buffer run using R to get the output back as an output buffer in vim (press <F4> or <F5>). In addition you can comment in/out lines of code with 'mc'.
install_details: I put the R.vim script in my .vim/after/syntax directory.
